sentences.en: Add them together, divide by five, and you've got the average. Okay?
sentences.cn: 把它们相加再除以5就是平均数，明白吗？

sentences.en: Average life expectancy went down from about 70 to 67.
sentences.cn: 平均预期寿命从70岁左右降到了67岁。

sentences.en: In 1970 the average size of a French farm was 19 hectares.
sentences.cn: 1970年，法国农场的平均规模为19公顷。

sentences.en: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.cn: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

sentences.en: Its profits are rising four times faster than the average company.
sentences.cn: 它的利润增长速度比一般公司快4倍。

sentences.en: Last winter was colder than average.
sentences.cn: 去年冬天比平常冷。

sentences.en: More than 7 million shares changed hands, treble the normal daily average.
sentences.cn: 有700多万股换手，是通常日平均成交量的3倍。

sentences.en: My fish average 2 lb 8 oz and I've had two eight-pounders.
sentences.cn: 我的鱼平均每条重2磅8盎司，还有过两条重8磅的。

sentences.en: On an average we would be spending £300 per day.
sentences.cn: 平均下来，我们每天要花费300英镑。

sentences.en: The age of the candidates ranged from 29 to 49 with an average age of 37.
sentences.cn: 候选人的年龄29岁至49岁不等，平均37岁。

sentences.en: The average age of the women interviewed was only 21.5.
sentences.cn: 参加面试的女性平均年龄才21.5岁。

sentences.en: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.cn: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.en: The average commuter journey there is five hours long.
sentences.cn: 那里的通勤一族平均上下班要花5个小时。

sentences.en: The average cost of making a movie has risen by 15%.
sentences.cn: 制作一部影片的平均成本上升了15%。

sentences.en: The average German will enjoy 40 days' paid holiday this year.
sentences.cn: 今年，德国人将平均享受40天的带薪假期。

sentences.en: The average Los Angeles commute is over 60 miles a day.
sentences.cn: 洛杉矶的平均上下班路程为每天60多英里。

sentences.en: The average Swede was off sick 27 days last year.
sentences.cn: 去年瑞典人平均休病假27天。

sentences.en: The average UK coal seam is one metre thick.
sentences.cn: 英国煤层的平均厚度为1米。

sentences.en: The cars were being sold at an average price of $11,000.
sentences.cn: 这些汽车的平均售价是1.1万美元。

sentences.en: The December figures brought the annual average for 2001 up to 10.6 per cent.
sentences.cn: 12月的数据将2001年的年平均水平提升到10.6%。

sentences.en: The train's average speed was no better than that of our bicycles.
sentences.cn: 火车的平均速度比我们骑自行车的速度快不了多少。

sentences.en: The water in the lake is not particularly deep, averaging about 12 metres.
sentences.cn: 湖水不是很深，平均约为12米。

sentences.en: Victoria Falls has had above average levels of rainfall this year.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚瀑布今年的降雨量超过了平均水平。

words.tran_cn: 平均；[数]平均数；[保险]海损

phrases.tran_cn: 平均以上；在一般水准以上
在一般水平(或平均数)以上
在一般水平(或平均数)以下

trans.tran_en: the average amount is the amount you get when you add together several quantities and divide this by the total number of quantities
the amount calculated by adding together several quantities, and then dividing this amount by the total number of quantities
the amount calculated by adding together several quantities, and then dividing this amount by the total number of quantities
to usually do something or usually happen a particular number of times, or to usually be a particular size or amount
